thread.title: Phi Slama Jama members reuniting for autograph show
thread.title_full: Phi Slama Jama members reuniting for autograph show

author: David Barron
title: Phi Slama Jama members reuniting for autograph show
text:
By David Barron , Houston Chronicle Published 4:10 pm, Wednesday, February 8, 2017 Photo: Fred Bunch, HP Staff Image 1 of / 4 Close Image 1 of 4 04/02/1983 - Houston Cougars celebrate their win against Louisville with high-fives in the NCAA Tournament Final Four semifinal at The Pit in Albuquerque, New Mexico 04/02/1983 - Houston Cougars celebrate their win against Louisville with high-fives in the NCAA Tournament Final Four semifinal at The Pit in Albuquerque, New Mexico Photo: Fred Bunch, HP Staff Image 2 of 4 04/02/1983 - Houston Cougars fan section shows their Phi Slama Jama support at the NCAA Tournament Final Four semifinal against Louisville at The Pit in Albuquerque, New Mex. 04/02/1983 - Houston Cougars fan section shows their Phi Slama Jama support at the NCAA Tournament Final Four semifinal against Louisville at The Pit in Albuquerque, New Mex. Photo: Larry Reese, HC Staff Image 3 of 4 03/25/1983 - Houston Cougars center Akeem Olajuwon (34) rebounds against Memphis State Tigers Andre Turner (10) in Midwest Regional Semifinal of the NCAA Tournament at Kemper Arena in Kansas City, Missouri. 03/25/1983 - Houston Cougars center Akeem Olajuwon (34) rebounds against Memphis State Tigers Andre Turner (10) in Midwest Regional Semifinal of the NCAA Tournament at Kemper Arena in Kansas City, Missouri. Photo: Jim McNay, HP Staff Image 4 of 4 ﻿Akeem Olajuwon had eight of UH's 13 dunks in the 1983 semifinal win over Louisville that's still considered one of the greatest NCAA Tournament games of all time. ﻿Akeem Olajuwon had eight of UH's 13 dunks in the 1983 semifinal win over Louisville that's still considered one of the greatest NCAA Tournament games of all time. Photo: Fred Bunch, HP Staff Phi Slama Jama members reuniting for autograph show 1 / 4 Back to Gallery 
Twelve members of the University of Houston's "Phi Slama Jama" basketball teams of the early 1980s will be among autograph guests at Tristar Productions' annual winter show this weekend at NRG Arena. 
Former players scheduled to sign autographs include Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler, Alvin Franklin, Lyndon Rose, Larry Micheauz, Greg Anderson, Eric Davis, Rickie Winslow, Michael Young, Reid Gettys, Renaldo Thomas and Eric Dickens. 
Jeff Rosenberg, Tristar's founder and president, said he has wanted for years to arrange an autograph reunion session for members of the teams that went to three Final Fours under coach Guy V. Lewis. 
"I know the emotions surrounding these teams," he said. "If you grew up in Houston, you'll always remember where you were when they played North Carolina State (in the 1983 NCAA championship game)." 
Rosenberg, however, was unable to convince team member Benny Anders, who until a recent appearance in an ESPN documentary on the team had not granted an interview in decades, to join his teammates at the show. 
"I wish they (Anders' teammates) could have explained to him how the fans would love to see him and how much fun he would have," Rosenberg said. 
Other autograph guests include newly minted Hall of Famer Jeff Bagwell and several Heisman Trophy recipients, including Earl Campbell and Mike Garrett. Times and prices for the Friday-Sunday show are at tristarproductions.com.
